reviewText: I just love Wild Kratts.  I watch them a whole lot.  I get to know the jungle without the horror of being in an actual jungle.  I like the lepeards best.  I am 5 years old.

my son age 4 found dvd at library and loves it. I had to buy it to be able to check out new movies at library. He has learned alot about the animals on the dvd.
he has been the animal experta sharing the information to me. I had order all 5 dvds of wild Kratts I could find.
I love the Kratt bros....my kiddos love them too. So happy to have these on DVD to take or save for later.

Ok so it's Wild Kratts so the shows are great but ANOTHER 2 Episode DVD. Even worse is it's advertised as 180 minutes but is only 55 minutes.

I love Wild Kratts - well actually my 5 year old thinks these guys are beyond awesome and I love the education, fun adventure and no horrible super-villains in this series (the baddies are tame). My issue with this release is Kratt Komercialisation, or the law of diminishing returns.

EPISODE COUNT
1st DVD - 8 Episodes (Creature Adventures)
2nd DVD - 4 Episodes (Predator Power)
3rd DVD - 4 Episodes (Jungle Animals)
4th DVD - 2 Episodes (Lost at Sea)
5th DVD - 2 Episodes (This title)

Looking at the trend I would not be surprised to see the next release being just 1 episode on the dvd.

The last 2 dvd's are released only 2 months apart. Could easily have been a single 4 episode DVD. Less materials, less packaging, less postage. Could have put the same profit on it (charged more for a 4 ep dvd). At this time you pay $1 less for the DVD than the previous 4 eps ones, but you get 50% less show with just 2 eps. Kratts gone Komercial again...

Just BEWARE - NOT 180 MINUTES AS ADVERTISED HERE ON AMAZON!

Education - 5 stars,
Quality - 5 stars,
Adventure - 5 stars,
Kratts Bros - 5 stars (they rock),
2 Episodes - 1 star,
Average - 4 stars.
My kids love wild kratts so was happy to add another DVD to their collection. I also love the fact that they learn a lot about animals etc while watching.

We LOVE Wild Kratts at our house!  Which is why we've been waiting over a month for this newest release with much anticitpation.  It arrived today and I'm not sure who was more disappointed: me or the kids, to discover there is only 55 minutes and two episodes worth of Wild Kratt joy on this dvd that was advertised as 180 minutes.  I guess I should have noticed the contradiction in that they specified the two episodes included on it, which obviously, cannot add up to 180 minutes running time.  They haven't finished watching it yet, but I wish I would have spent a few more dollars for the other dvd which was longer and available a month ago.  Bummed.

absolutely LOVE IT!!  we are fascinated by all the things my daughter is learning from the wild Kratts.  She now wants to be a zoologist like the wild Kratt brothers.  SHE IS 10 YEARS OLD.

The program is beautiful, fun, entertaining and educational!!  I am absolutely thrilled with it.  Thank you PBS for producing such great programs and thank you wild Kratts for your great job.  We are very pleased!

Adults may think that this is just a fancy update of "Mutual of Omaha's Wild Kingdom," but kids see and enjoy it as an exciting adventure in learning. Of particular note is that, for a show that needs PBS funding, "Wild Kratts" (Kratt is the brothers' name) stresses science and Nature rather than mumbo-jumbo.
My three year old son is a big fan of wild kratts. He absolutely loves to watch it and I'm so happy since he learns a lot about animals.
I bought this DVD for my granddaughter and she loves it.  She watches it just about every day and has even written a fan letter to the Wild Kratts!  Good show for the little ones.

I kind of don't like the new marketing strategy where only a couple of show are on each DVD. My boys are avid Wild Kratts fans (and frankly, so am I) so I wish they'd do these in seasons like the did the first time around (even though not all of the shows from the first season were even on the season 1 DVD). It would make it way more convenient and a little less wasteful, actually, to have several episodes on one disc, maybe with two discs in one box in stead of 2 shows on one disc in one box. Other than that, we love the Wild Kratts. Also, I wish they'd put the extra snippets on that they tag at the end of the shows when you're actually watching them on PBS.
